definition: Jinshan Temple, where Fahai lives (from Madam White Snake)
gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
mountain/hill/anything that resembles a mountain/CL:座[zuo4]/bundled straw in which silkworms spin cocoons/gable

sentences.english: Outside of the Jinshan Temple, Bai Suzhen cannot find her husband so she get the water filled the Temple.
sentences.chinese: 金山寺外，白素贞寻夫不得，只得水漫金山。

definition: Leifeng Pagoda, by West Lake until it was destroyed (also from Madam White Snake)
Fahai, name of the evil Buddhist monk in Tale of the White Snake 白蛇傳
Mt Potala at Zhoushan 舟山市 in Zhejiang, one of the Four Sacred Mountains and Bodhimanda of Guanyin 觀音|观音 (Avalokiteśvara)
the Baima or White Horse Temple in Luoyang, one of the earliest Buddhist temples in China
Hall of Great Strength, main hall of a Buddhist temple containing the main image of veneration 大雄[da4 xiong2]
Mt Jiuhua in Anhui, one of the Four Sacred Mountains and Bodhimanda of Kṣitigarbha 地藏
(name of a person) Bai Suzhen, from Madame White Snake
